title: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

title: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
author: Albert Schweitzer

title: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

title: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

title: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

title: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

title: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

title: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

title: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

title: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

title: Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

title: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

title: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

title: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

title: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

title: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

title: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

title: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

title: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

title: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

title: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

title: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

title: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

title: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

title: Difficulties in life are intended to make us better, not bitter.
author: Dan Reeves

title: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

title: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

title: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

title: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington
